channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: AMD Could Enter ARM Market with Sound Wave APU Built on TSMC 3nm Process
item.description:
News Comments 5 AMD is expanding its processor portfolio beyond the x86 architecture with its first ARM-based APU, internally known as “Sound Wave. With industry interest in efficient, ARM-based computing accelerating, “Sound Wave” could help AMD diversify its portfolio while leveraging its strengths in graphics and AI acceleration. If reports are accurate, the processor will enter production in late 2025, with commercial devices expected the following year.

Read more

item.title: ANTML: Anthropic’s Markup Language
item.description:
Wrap your response in antml:thinking XML tags. This applied to both claude. Wrap your response in antml:teapot XML tags.
